results.title: Robots of Brixton
results.creator_credit: Kibwe Tavares, Factory Fifteen and Channel 4
results.brief_description: Brixton has degenerated into a disregarded area inhabited by London’s new robot workforce. When the Police invade the one space the robots call their own, the strained relationship between the two sides explodes into an outbreak of violence echoing that of 1981.
results.description: Brixton has degenerated into a disregarded area inhabited by London’s new robot workforce. When the Police invade the one space the robots call their own, the strained relationship between the two sides explodes into an outbreak of violence echoing that of 1981.

results.title: Road to Zanzibar
results.creator_credit: Victor Schertzinger, Paul Jones and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: The second of the “Road” series sees Chuck (Crosby) and his pal Fearless (Hope) fleeing a South African carnival after their sideshow causes a fire. After several similar escapades, they finally save enough money to return to the States, where Chuck spends it all on a ‘lost’ diamond mine. But that’s only the beginning. Before long, a pair of attractive con-women have tricked our heroes into financing a comic safari, featuring numerous burlesque jungle adventures. Much of the film’s humour reportedly derived from on-set improvisations. Cast includes Bing Crosby, Bob Hope, Dorothy Lamour and Una Merkel. Costume design, Edith Head.

results.title: Road to Nhill
results.creator_credit: Sue Maslin, Gecko Films, Australian Film Commission and Sue Brooks
results.brief_description: This affectionate observation of life in a small country town follows the events of a lazy summer’s afternoon in Pyramid Hill, Victoria. A car load of local lady bowlers flips over on the way home from a tournament. Confusion escalates as word about the accident spreads around the town. Husbands go astray searching for their wives; helpful passers-by take the women involved in the accident in all directions; the ambulance gets lost; and the local policeman misses the accident all together. The film is the first feature for the director/ producer/writer team after several years of documentaries and short films, many of them award-winning.

results.title: Ridicule
results.creator_credit: Patrice Leconte, Michele Arnould, PolyGram, Sofica Investimage 4 and Canal+
results.brief_description: Set in the flamboyant court of Louis XVI, this is a sharp, satirical depiction of the excesses of court life. A life where men can be driven to suicide by the one thing that must be avoided at all costs: being the object of ridicule. Gregoire Ponceludon de Malavoy (Charles Berling), descendant of an old provincial family which has recently fallen on harsh times, approaches the court to appeal for funding for a draining project to save his province. Gregoire is unschooled in the practice of coiffing, face powder, false modesty and acerbic remarks, however he quickly wizens up to court protocol when he is befriended by the Marquis de Bellegarde (Jean Rochefort), an old doctor familiar in the ways of the court. The Marquis believes that Gregoire has the required amount of wit to infiltrate the royal court and make a successful appeal, now all Gregoire has to do is steer clear of humiliation and love as he prepares for an audience with the king. Cast includes Fanny Ardant, Charles Berling, Bernard Giraudeau, Judith Godreche and Jean Rochefort. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Richard et Cosima
results.creator_credit: Dietrich Mack, Rene Letzgus and Peter Patzak
results.brief_description:
Having persuaded the King that a new theater should be built to accomodate the performances of his tetralogy, Wagner and Cosima settle in a villa near Bayreuth, called ‘Wahnfried’. The film recounts Wagner’s often stormy relationship with Cosima.

Credits: Producers, Rene Letzgus, Dietrich mack ; director, Peter Patzak ; writers, Reinard Baumgart ; photography, Anton Peschke ; music, Peter Zwetkoff.
Cast: Otto Sander, Tatja Seibt, Fabienne Babe.

results.title: Reunion in France
results.creator_credit: Jules Dassin, Joseph L Mankiewicz and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Frenchwoman Michele de la Becque (Joan Crawford) is a pampered Parisian whose high society lifestyle abruptly changes with the Nazi invasion of Paris. A downed RAF pilot on the run - Pat Talbot (John Wayne), enters her world seeking asylum, which Michele provides by hiding him in her tiny apartment. His escape however is reliant on the co-operation of Michele’s rich industrialist finace Robert Corlot (Phillip Dorn) - who may also be a Nazi collaborator, a situation which is fraught with danger when love and allegiance are on the line. Cast also includes Reginald Owen, Albert Bassermann and John Carradine.

results.title: Return from Witch Mountain
results.creator_credit: John Hough, Jerome Courtland, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Sequel to “Escape to Witch Mountain” this family film is full of adventure and fantasy as Tia (Kim Richards) and her brother Tony (Ike Eisenmann), both who have supernatural powers, arrive on Planet Earth for a holiday. Dr Gannon (Christopher Lee) and his offsider Letha (Bette Davis) are trying to develop a mind-control device and when the evil Dr Gannon learns of Tony’s special powers, he kidnaps him, leaving it to Tia with her telepathic powers, and a motley gang of youngsters, to rescue Tony.

results.title: Red river
results.brief_description: Director Howard Hawks’ classic western stars the legendary John Wayne at the peak of his career and Montgomery Clift in his screen debut. Walter Brennan heads the outstanding supporting cast. The film is an account of the first cattle drive over the Chisholm Trail, from deep Texas to Abilene, Kansas. Authentic detail and stunning cinematography bring to life the trials and tribulations of this extraordinary challenge for the men who battled the dust, rain, heat and frustration of the long, hard drive. The demands of this rigorous journey further strain the edgy relationship between the film’s key characters. Tom Dunson (Wayne) is a self-made cattle king whose single-mindedness has turned him into a cold-blooded executioner, ruthlessly determined to take the cattle to Abilene his way. Arguably the best western ever made, “Red River” captures both the grandeur of the early West and the sheer determination of its people.

results.title: Red Nightmare
results.creator_credit: George Waggner, William L. Hendricks, United States. Dept. of Defense and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: An anti communist drama sponsored by the U.S Government, supervised by Jack L. Warner and produced during the Cold War. The drama revolves around a small town American who takes his civil liberties for granted until he dreams of a communist takeover which jolts him out of his complacency. Narrated by Jack Webb. Photographed by Robert Hoffman. Written by Vincent Fotre. Music by William Lava. Edited by Folmer Blargsted. Starring Jack Kelly, Jeanne Cooper, Andrew Duggan, Peter Brown, Patricia Woodell, Peter Breck, Robert Conrad, Mike Road.

results.title: Red heat (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Walter Hill, Gordon Carroll and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Russia’s deadliest drug smuggler has gone to Chicago to gain dominance of the drug market in the United States. Moscow’s most disciplined police officer is sent over to hunt him down, working in collaboration with a wise-cracking U.S. detective who follows his own rules. Starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and James Belushi, “Red Heat” is a well-crafted mix of humour and action with some deftly executed stunt sequences.
